name: The Spencer Suite
bathroomType: En-suite with soaking tub and separate shower
description: Named after Richard Spencer, the original owner, this grand master suite occupies the entire front of the second floor. Original 1854 architectural details include an ornate ceiling medallion, Italian marble fireplace, and floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking Pine Street. The renovated spa bathroom features a clawfoot soaking tub, walk-in shower with rain head, heated floors, and double vanity.

featuredImage.alt: The Spencer Suite master bedroom with king bed and marble fireplace

features: Spa bathroom with soaking tub and rain shower
viewDescription: Tree-lined Pine Street and neighboring historic homes
historicalNote: This room served as the master bedroom for the Spencer family from 1854-1899, and later as the private quarters of suffragette leader Anna Howard Shaw during her 1915 visit to Philadelphia.

name: The Garden Suite
description: A ground-floor sanctuary with direct access to the private courtyard garden. This suite combines the intimacy of a boutique hotel with the charm of a historic home. Originally the library and morning room, it features original hardwood floors, built-in bookshelves, and French doors opening to the garden terrace.

featuredImage.alt: The Garden Suite with French doors to courtyard

viewDescription: Private courtyard garden with fountain and seating area
historicalNote: This space served as the gentlemen's library and smoking room in the Victorian era. The built-in bookshelves still contain some original leather-bound volumes from the 1890s.

name: The Parlor Suite
description: A two-room suite offering the grandeur of a historic parlor combined with modern bedroom comfort. The bedroom features a king bed and original fireplace, while the adjoining sitting room provides a separate space for relaxation or remote work. Tall windows flood both rooms with natural light.

featuredImage.alt: The Parlor Suite sitting room with chandelier

features: Adjoining sitting room with period furniture
Writing desk suitable for remote work
viewDescription: Historic Rittenhouse neighborhood architecture and tree-lined streets
historicalNote: Originally the ladies' parlor where afternoon tea and social calls took place. The crystal chandelier dates to 1875 and was electrified in 1910.

name: The Tower Rooms
description: Perfect for families or friends traveling together, this third-floor suite consists of two connected bedrooms sharing a renovated bathroom. Both rooms feature original dormer windows and charming architectural details. The shared bathroom includes both a soaking tub and separate shower.

featuredImage.alt: The Tower Rooms with dormer windows

features: Two separate bedrooms, each with queen bed
Shared bathroom with tub and shower
Ample closet space in each room
viewDescription: Rooftop views of Rittenhouse Square neighborhood
historicalNote: These rooms housed the Spencer family children in the 1850s-1880s. Later served as servants' quarters during the Gilded Age.

name: The Heritage Quarters
description: The largest suite in the residence, ideal for multi-generational families or groups. Three bedrooms share two fully renovated bathrooms on the third floor. This suite offers the most flexibility for sleeping arrangements and provides a semi-private wing for your group.
features: Two full bathrooms (one with tub, one with shower)
Common sitting area with seating for 6
viewDescription: Neighborhood views and distant city skyline
historicalNote: This entire wing was added during the 1899 renovation for the growing Spencer-Ashbridge family. It represents the expansion of Philadelphia's wealthy families during the Gilded Age.
